Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <ca888_v1> Why? What scenario are you wanting protection against here? Logging in to Agama on a public PC then forgetting to log out, and walking away? Not trying to be funny, I don't get why extra security layers after unlocking your wallet with the private key would achieve. Surely no need, I see extra passwords as extra hassle. One private key to get you in, then you're free, caveat emptor. This would inconvenience every user every time they want to use the service, just to help one person in an unlikely scenario. Am I missing something? (re @bitcoinfiat: @Acura360 . What I meant is different from what you sent me. What I meant was when you about sending out some KMD in agama, it should prompt a spending password before the release of the coin.)
